com.telek.telekgdx.screens

Class ScreenSorter<TGAME extends com.badlogic.gdx.Game>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telek.telekgdx.screens.ScreenSorter<TGAME>
  • Type Parameters:
    TGAME - a type that extends the Game

    public class ScreenSorter<TGAME extends com.badlogic.gdx.Game>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class helps you organize your screens in an optimized way especially if you're going to have multiple screens of a single class that extends Screen.

    This class only accepts screens that implement TScreen. The TScreen class defines two additional methods: update(dt), configure().

    You're supposted to reset every single field, input etc. you have in the screen in the configure() method. This means you need to write more code but it will pay off at the end.

    You can also use update(dt) as your update method in each screen, this is a very common method to have in every screen so TScreen automaticly defines this method for you!

      • getScreen

        public <T extends TScreen> T getScreen(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the screen with the specified key from the screensorter, creates a new screen if the current existing one is null. It also runs the tScreen.configure() before returning it (allowing you to reset fields, inputs etc. before you get the screen)
        Type Parameters:
        T - any class that extends TScreen
        Parameters:
        key - a key
        Returns:
        The screen with the specified key from the screensorter
